item.title: Neural Networks - The Hessian Matrix
item.description: 5.4 The Hessian Matrix Backpropagation can also be used to evaluate the second derivatives of the error, given by $$\begin{align} H = \frac{\partial^2 E}{\partial W_{ji}\partial W_{lk}} \end{align}$$ An important consideration for many applications of the Hessian is the efficienc with which it can be evaluated. If there are $W$ parameters (weights and biases) in the network, then the Hessian matrix has dimensions $W \times W$ and so the computational effort needed to evaluate the Hessian will scale like $O(W^2)$ for each pattern in the data set.
